meanings.definition: Spoil or impair the quality or efficiency of
meanings.sent1: Leaving food out in the sun can vitiating its freshness.
meanings.sent2: The rainstorm vitiating the picnic plans.
meanings.sent3: Accidentally spilling juice on the board game vitiating the fun.
meanings.sent4: The negative comments vitiating her self-confidence.
meanings.sent5: The virus spread quickly, vitiating the entire population.

meanings.sent1: Forgetting to sign the document can vitiating its legality.
meanings.sent2: The missing ingredient vitiating the recipe.
meanings.sent3: The torn ticket vitiating his chance to win the prize.
meanings.sent4: The outdated software vitiating the security measures.
meanings.sent5: The false information vitiating the research findings.

meanings.sent1: The dishonest politician's actions vitiating the trust of the people.
meanings.sent2: The greed of the corporation vitiating their ethical standards.
meanings.sent3: The forbidden fruit vitiating the innocence of the child.
meanings.sent4: The toxic relationship vitiating her sense of self-worth.
meanings.sent5: The power of greed vitiating the purity of the environment.
